text: Nicholas James Loftin (born September 25, 1998) is an American professional baseball shortstop in the Kansas City Royals organization. He was selected by the Royals with the 32nd overall pick in the 2020 Major League Baseball draft. ==Career== Loftin attended W. B. Ray High School in Corpus Christi, Texas, where he played baseball.https://www.caller.com/story/sports/high- school/baseball/2017/06/24/q-a-all-south-texas-baseball-mvp-nick- loftin/424346001/ As a senior in 2017, he batted .465 with three home runs alongside going 11–4 with a 1.10 ERA on the mound.https://www.iwacc.org/uploaded/images/Campus_News/2016-2017/Angels_in_the_News/2017-06-26_4C_IWA_Senior_Makes_All- South_Texas_Baseball_Team_CALLER.pdf He originally committed to play college baseball at Texas A&M; University–Corpus Christi, but later switched his commitment to Baylor University.https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/local/hometown- heroes/2019/04/02/hometown-heroes-five-questions-baylors-nick- loftin/3291591002/ Undrafted in the 2017 Major League Baseball draft, he enrolled at Baylor.http://baseballprospectjournal.com/nick-loftin-prides- himself-on-team-first-mindset/ In 2018, Loftin's freshman year at Baylor, he appeared in 55 games (making 53 starts), batting .306 with six home runs and 36 RBIs, earning Freshman All-American honors alongside being named to the Big 12 Conference All-Second Team and All-Freshman
